events.comment: Player Manager: Used for controlling the player character and handling events related to it
When the move player event is triggered, move the player to the given location.
When a player is given a new destination, player moves to it.
Item/Inventory Manager: Used for managing items in the environment
Camera Manager: Used for managing the in-game camera and player tracking
Player Inventory Manager: Used for managing the player's inventory and items inside it
When player runs into an item, add it to player's inventory and delete it.
If "c" is pressed or the collect button is clicked...
For each item touching the player, collect it and delete it. Also, add it to the inventory panel, giving it's name, item name, and position.
When the player equips an item, unequip the current item and make the item to be equipped the current item.
If there is an item equipped, unequip it.
Make the item to be equipped the currently equiped one.
Reset the event
World Manager: Used for controlling the world and certain aspects of it
Use a scene variable to control the ambient darkness of the room
Control the sizing of the darkness panel to fill the screen
Manage the Z-Order of light-emitting objects
Passive-light objects receive light from light objects when in contact
Show item collect button when player is touching an item
When player presses "c" or clicks/touches collect button, trigger the collect event.
If the timer of a touch object reaches 300 milliseconds, set its 'isHold' flag to true.
When a touch object has depreciated, it expands and fades.
If a new touch occurs, add a new touch object to it.
Make button light up when hovering over it and fade when not
When button is clicked, bring up the inventory menu.
When menu is displayed, stop time in all layers but the inventory panel.
If direction is "out", slide the panel up and increment the timer. Max timer value: 500 ms
If direction is "in", slide the panel down and decrement the timer. Min timer value: 0 ms
While the menu is moving, get rid of any inventory item text.
Move the objects with the panel
When menu is moving, change its position by the amount on its timer.
When menu is not displayed, deselect all objects.
Keep the inventory panel close button in the upper-right hand corner of the panel.
When panel is clicked, drop the menu down.
Keep the inventory panel close button in the upper-right hand corner of the panel.
When inv drop button is clicked, drop selected items.
Keep the inventory panel close button in the upper-right hand corner of the panel.
When hovering over an item in the inventory, display the item's name.
When an item is clicked/tapped on, toggle its selection status.
If an item is selected, display the aura behind it.
When the inventory panel is closed, remove the aura from all items.
